Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : ambition, taxation, wealth. While in a senate majority, once per turn may add 1 to your total attrition in battle for each character with an ambition agenda at Galactic Senate.
IsPulled: Squabbling Delegates

Lore: Massive cargo vessels that were converted by the Trade Federation into armed battleships. Each is equipped with a large contingent of droid starfighters and battle droids.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. While with any starfighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
Information: The Trade Federation Battleship is the standard capital ship in the Trade Federation fleet. Its solid stats include a healthy power, armor, and forfeit.\par With four empty pilot slots to fill, this ship can quickly become a juggernaut when piloted by Neimoidian Pilots or "classic trilogy" pilots like Danz Borin.\par With space to carry 4 starfighters, the Trade Federation Battleship can easily transport its own armada of Droid Starfighters. This combination of ships is further encouraged by the deploy bonus Droid Starfighters get when they deploy at the same system as a battleship.\par \par The Trade Federation Battleship benefits from these starfighters by drawing a battle destiny if unable to otherwise when present with a fighter. This text comes in handy when you have a squadron of Droid Starfighters that lack the ability to draw destiny on their own.
Combo: Trade Federation Battleship + Naboo + Neimoidian Pilots\par Neimoidian Pilots deploy free and activate 1 Force each time they deploy. How often do you have more active Force after your deploy phase than before?\par -----\par Trade Federation Battleship + Droid Starfighters + Battle Deployment\par Each player's ships are power -2 at systems where he doesn't have both a capital ship and a starfighter. Since Trade Federation Battleships and Droid Starfighters are meant to go together, you already have that covered. Does your opponent?\par -----\par Trade Federation Battleship + Sil Unch

Characteristics: Trade Federation (starship), Droid Control Ship, ship-docking capability
Lore: These heavily modified battleships are used to control and direct the Trade Federation automated army. Easily identified by its array of sensors and antennae.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 starfighters. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Has ship-docking capability. While a droid starfighter here, adds one battle destiny.
Information: This unique ship... wait a second, let's look at that card again! This ship isn't unique. Instead, the diamond-shaped symbol before the title indicates that the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship is limited to one copy per system. Previously, these markings have mostly appeared on locations. Indeed, this is the first ship to use this icon.\par \par The numbers on Trade Federation Droid Control Ship compare favorably with the non-unique Trade Federation Battleship. Its power and forfeit are reduced by 1, but this reduction is balanced by the increased armor, ability, and the reduced deploy cost.\par \par The Droid Control Ship is crucial for the proper functioning of the Trade Federation's droid starfighters, reflected by both the power penalty the droid starfighters suffer when not present with this important ship as well as the deploy bonus they receive when deploying to the same system. Needless to say, it is recommended that your droid starfighters stay close to this ship.\par \par Deploy the Laser Cannon Battery aboard to not only hit your opponent's ships, but cause a 1 Force loss to direct damage when you do so. Add Imperial Artillery to add another Force loss, either during your Control phase or after successfully hitting a ship with the Battery (or both, since Imperial Artillery can be used twice per turn!). Deploy the Neimoidian Pilot aboard (for free at Naboo) and activate an extra Force when doing so. Tey How can also make herself useful here, giving you the ability to reduce Force lost to drains at nearby parsecs.
Combo: Federation Droid Control Ship + Neimodian Pilot + Tey How + Droid Starfighter\par Power 12 plus 2 battle destiny. Add a few more pilots and/or ships to maintain control of a system while Tey How reduces your Force loss to drains at systems within 2 parsecs.\par -----\par Federation Droid Control Ship + Sil Unch

Lore: Tusken Raiders are constantly taking bets to see who can hit the most Podracers on the Boonta Eve racetrack.
Gametext: While at Podrace Arena, if opponent just placed race destiny on their Podracer, once per turn may use 3 Force to 'shoot' (no other Tusken Raiders may 'shoot' this turn). Draw destiny. If destiny > 3, place race destiny in opponent's hand.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: With enough political support, any number of devious plans can be put into motion.
Gametext: During your control phase, draw destiny. If destiny > 2, draw up to X cards (maximum 4) from Reserve Deck, where X = your total politics at Galactic Senate minus opponent's total politics at Galactic Senate.

Lore: "Vote now! Vote now! Vote now!"
Gametext: During your control phase, draw destiny. If destiny > 2, draw up to X cards (maximum 4) from Reserve Deck, where X = your total politics at Galactic Senate minus opponent's total politics at Galactic Senate.
Information: Do you like drawing extra cards? Do you like recycling cards? If so, then this is the card for your Light Senator deck.\par No matter whether the game just started, or it's almost over, this is never a bad card. Early on, you can play this and if you're lucky, you can draw some extra cards, but even if not, you've still recycled a 5. In the mid to late game when you may have set up some destinies, this can give you some guaranteed card draws, if you're in control of the senate. And what's even better, if you've somehow lost control of the Senate, you can still play it as a recyclable 5.

Lore: \b Senator\b0  who opposes the taxation of trade routes. Some say that a recent move from his homeworld to a luxurious Coruscant abode is evidence of his corruption.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : trade, wealth. While in a senate majority, once during your turn, may peek at top card of opponent's Reserve Deck; return that card or lose 1 Force to make it lost.
Information: With his trade agenda, he works well with This Is Outrageous! by allowing you to exchange cards you don't need from your hand for (hopefully) better cards in your Lost Pile.\par And with his wealth agenda, he allows you to fully utilize Motion Supported to enhance your battle destinies. But the rest of his game text is what sets him apart from the rest of the senators. Looking at your opponent's destinies would be a very useful ability by itself. It lets you decide whether it would be a good idea to battle since you check whether your opponent's weapon destinies will be dangerous to you, or if you can handle that draw against you for battle destiny.\par But Yeb Yeb goes further by tilting the tides of chance in your favor. If the destiny is low, you can leave it on your opponent's Reserve Deck, but if it's a high destiny you can make it lost and try your luck with the next card.
IsPulled: Squabbling Delegates
Combo: Yeb Yeb Adem'thorn + senate majority + a 6 on opponent's Reserve Deck\par Not any more...\par -----\par Yeb Yeb Adem'thorn + senate majority + only one card in opponent's Reserve Deck\par No destiny for your opponent!\par -----\par Yeb Yeb Adem'thorn + Rune Haako\par Destiny of zero for your opponent.
